page.title: 10DAYS GONE BY
page.content: They had to wear handed down clothes from the rest of the family. In the Summer the people of Moorends went on a day trip to Cleethorpes, and it was paid for by 'Uncle Arthur', a local shop-keeper. The children din't have many sweets, mostly mints. Most of the people liked fish and chips and apple pies. There were two policemen in the village that kept law and order. Their names were P.C.Bainbridge and 'Bobby' Mills. The people always shared with each other. For instance, if a boy wanted a turnip to make a lantern, he'd ask if he could have one and the farmer would tell him to take a couple. The children had no pocket-money. The first time they did have any was when they got a job. Their parents would give them some of their wages.
